episodeTitle: Save the Children! The Master's Evil Hands Close in!
description: Caesar Clown confronts Nami and Usopp to retrieve the children, demonstrating his deadly gas manipulation abilities. Brownbeard attempts to intervene but is defeated. Meanwhile, Zoro's group flees from Smiley as it begins its transformation into the deadly Shinokuni gas. Caesar broadcasts his weapons demonstration to brokers across the New World.

events.title: Caesar Arrives at Ruined Lab
events.description: Caesar Clown arrives at the ruined laboratory section where Nami and Usopp are protecting the children. He demands the children be returned to him, setting up the confrontation.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the episode's main conflict between Caesar and the Straw Hat Pirates protecting the children.

events.title: Caesar Demonstrates Oxygen Removal
events.description: Caesar uses his Gasu Gasu no Mi abilities to remove oxygen from the air around Nami and Usopp, suffocating them. This demonstrates the terrifying control he has over gases and his willingness to kill.
events.significance: Shows the extent of Caesar's Devil Fruit powers and establishes him as a serious threat who will kill without hesitation.

quotes.text: My ability allows me to control the air itself!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar explains his power while suffocating Nami and Usopp

events.title: Children Ordered to Attack Nami and Usopp
events.description: Caesar orders the drug-addicted children to crush Nami and Usopp with metal poles if they want candy. The children, suffering from withdrawal symptoms, begin to comply, showing the depth of their addiction and Caesar's manipulation.
events.significance: Demonstrates the cruel extent of Caesar's manipulation of the children through drug addiction, showing how their desperation for the candy overrides their natural reluctance to harm others.

events.title: Brownbeard's Rescue and Confrontation
events.description: Brownbeard appears and saves Nami and Usopp from being crushed by the children. He confronts Caesar, furious about Caesar's deceits and demanding his crew back, having finally realized Caesar's true nature.
events.significance: Marks Brownbeard's turning point from Caesar's subordinate to someone who recognizes Caesar's evil and attempts to stop him, though he lacks the power to succeed.

quotes.text: I want my crew back, Caesar!
quotes.speaker: Brownbeard
quotes.context: Brownbeard demands his crew from Caesar, having learned of the betrayal

events.title: Gastanet Technique First Use
events.description: Caesar uses his Gastanet technique for the first time in the anime, filling castanets with explosive gas and clapping them together to create a massive explosion that defeats Brownbeard.
events.significance: Introduction of one of Caesar's signature offensive techniques, demonstrating his ability to weaponize his gas powers for direct combat.

events.title: Caesar Defeats Nami and Usopp
events.description: After defeating Brownbeard, Caesar turns back to Nami and Usopp and uses another Gastanet attack, knocking them both unconscious. He then orders the children onto his ship, declaring the location unsafe.
events.significance: Caesar successfully captures the children and neutralizes the Straw Hats who were trying to protect them, advancing his plan for the weapons demonstration.

events.title: Zoro's Group Flees from Smiley
events.description: Zoro, Sanji, Brook, and Kin'emon continue running from Smiley, which has transferred itself to the ice lands. All of Smiley's scattered pieces begin converging together.
events.significance: Shows the ongoing danger of Smiley and sets up its transformation into Shinokuni, the deadly weapon of mass destruction.

events.title: Smiley Eats the Giant Candy
events.description: Zoro's group notices a giant piece of candy on the ice lands. Smiley, while chasing them, sees the candy and promptly swallows it whole, beginning its transformation.
events.significance: The candy contains the catalyst that will transform Smiley into Shinokuni, the deadly petrifying gas that Caesar plans to demonstrate as his weapon of mass destruction.

events.title: Smiley Begins Transformation to Shinokuni
events.description: After eating the candy, Smiley lets out a roar and begins to dissolve into gas. One of the centaurs gets caught in the spreading gas and becomes petrified, demonstrating the deadly nature of what's to come.
events.significance: The transformation of Smiley into Shinokuni marks the beginning of Caesar's weapons demonstration and the deadly threat that will affect all of Punk Hazard.

events.title: Caesar's Broadcast to New World Brokers
events.description: Caesar calls Monet to confirm the broadcast is ready, then sends a televised message to all pirates and brokers in the New World, announcing he's selling a weapon of mass destruction that even the Marines wish they had.
events.significance: Introduces the underworld broker network and sets up Caesar's demonstration, showing the larger criminal economy of the One Piece world and how scientific weapons are traded.

quotes.text: I'm selling a weapon of mass destruction that the Marines wish they had!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar's broadcast message to the underworld brokers

events.title: Eustass Kid and Killer Watch Broadcast
events.description: Eustass Kid and Killer are shown watching Caesar's broadcast from their location in the New World. Kid expresses interest in staying informed about such weapons rather than purchasing them.
events.significance: First appearance of Kid and Killer since the time skip in an anime-original scene, showing they're active in the New World and monitoring dangerous developments.

events.title: Pekoms and Tamago Watch Broadcast
events.description: Pekoms and Tamago, members of the Big Mom Pirates, are shown watching Caesar's broadcast from their location, indicating Big Mom's interest in Caesar's weapons.
events.significance: Establishes the Big Mom Pirates' interest in Caesar's research and foreshadows their involvement in the Punk Hazard situation, connecting to the larger plot.

quotes.text: My ability allows me to control the air itself!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Explaining his Gasu Gasu no Mi power while suffocating Nami and Usopp

quotes.text: I want my crew back, Caesar!
quotes.speaker: Brownbeard

quotes.text: I'm selling a weapon of mass destruction that the Marines wish they had!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Broadcasting to underworld brokers in the New World

themes.description: The episode powerfully depicts how Caesar has manipulated the children through drug addiction, using their withdrawal symptoms and desperation to control them completely.
themes.symbolism: The candy represents both the children's imprisonment and Caesar's cruel manipulation, showing how addiction can be weaponized.
culturalReferences: Commentary on pharmaceutical manipulation and drug addiction

themes.description: Caesar's willingness to experiment on children and create weapons of mass destruction highlights the dangers of science without morality or ethical constraints.
themes.symbolism: Caesar represents the mad scientist archetype, showing what happens when scientific knowledge is pursued without regard for human life.
culturalReferences: References to real-world concerns about weapons of mass destruction and unethical human experimentation

themes.description: The episode introduces the criminal broker network in the New World, showing how weapons, information, and other illicit goods are traded in the One Piece world.
themes.symbolism: The broadcast Den Den Mushi represents the interconnected nature of the criminal underworld and how information spreads in this world.

characterSpotlights.development: Caesar is shown at his most villainous, demonstrating his complete lack of empathy as he suffocates Nami and Usopp, manipulates addicted children, and prepares to use them all in a deadly weapons demonstration.
keyActions: Confronts Nami and Usopp at the ruined lab
Orders children to attack the Straw Hats
Broadcasts weapons demonstration to New World brokers
quotes: My ability allows me to control the air itself!
I'm selling a weapon of mass destruction that the Marines wish they had!

characterSpotlights.development: Brownbeard completes his arc from Caesar's loyal subordinate to someone who recognizes Caesar's evil. He attempts to save Nami and Usopp and demands his crew back, showing moral growth despite being quickly defeated.
keyActions: Appears to save Nami and Usopp from the children
quotes: I want my crew back, Caesar!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami continues her role as protector of the children, facing Caesar despite the danger, though she and Usopp are ultimately overpowered by his abilities.
Usopp attempts to fight Caesar to protect the children, showing his growth in bravery, though he lacks the power to overcome Caesar's Devil Fruit abilities.
keyActions: Is suffocated and then knocked out by Caesar

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime adds extended scenes of Chopper sneaking around, which provides additional context not present in the manga chapter.
The anime includes additional context about Doflamingo's history at Marineford that wasn't in this specific manga chapter.
The scenes showing Eustass Kid, Killer, Pekoms, and Tamago watching the broadcast are expanded in the anime with additional dialogue and reactions.

trivia.fact: Episode 600 is a milestone episode, marking 600 episodes of the One Piece anime since it began in 1999.
This episode adapts Chapter 674 of the manga, titled 'The Observers,' covering pages 2-17.
The episode had an 8.0% TV rating in Japan and ranked 5th in viewership when it aired.
The eyecatcher for this episode features Nami with the One Piece logo.
Caesar's Gastanet technique name is a pun on 'castanets,' the musical instruments he uses to create the explosions.
